text: Pepinia verrucosa is a species of plant in the family Bromeliaceae. It is endemic to Ecuador. Its natural habitats are subtropical or tropical moist lowland forests and subtropical or tropical moist montane forests. It is threatened by habitat loss. ==Sources== * Manzanares, J.M. & Pitman, N. 2003. Pepinia verrucosa. 2006 IUCN Red List of Threatened Species. Downloaded on 23 August 2007.
